items.q: Which part of the eye controls the amount of light entering?
items.explanation: The iris expands and contracts to alter the pupil size.

items.q: All metals are solid at room temperature.
items.explanation: Mercury is a metal that is liquid at room temperature.

items.q: Saturn is the only planet with rings.
items.explanation: Jupiter, Uranus, and Neptune also have ring systems.

items.q: What gas causes the greenhouse effect on Venus?
items.explanation: Its thick CO2 atmosphere creates a runaway greenhouse effect.

items.q: What do we call an organism that feeds on dead material?
items.explanation: Fungi and bacteria are major decomposers.

items.q: What metric unit is used to measure force?
What is the primary function of red blood cells?
items.explanation: Hemoglobin in red blood cells binds to oxygen.

items.q: What type of wave is an earthquake's primary wave?
items.explanation: P-waves are the fastest seismic waves.

items.q: Name the phase of cell division where one cell divides into two identical cells.
What is the most common element in the universe?
items.explanation: Hydrogen makes up about 75% of the universe's elemental mass.
